en.title: Integrated Digital Maternal and Child Health Platform
en.purpose: Implement a comprehensive digital health platform that supports the continuum of care for mothers and children from pregnancy through the first five years of life, improving health outcomes through coordinated care delivery, real-time monitoring, and evidence-based interventions.
en.scope:
This use case encompasses the development and deployment of an integrated digital platform that:

- Manages the complete maternal and child health continuum from antenatal care to childhood development
- Integrates clinical care, immunization tracking, growth monitoring, and nutrition counseling
- Supports community health workers with mobile tools for home visits and referrals
- Provides real-time analytics for program monitoring and quality improvement
- Enables patient engagement through mobile health applications and SMS reminders
- Facilitates supply chain management for essential medicines and vaccines
en.actors:
**Primary Healthcare Providers:**
- **Obstetricians and Midwives** – Provide specialized maternal care and delivery services
- **Pediatricians and Nurses** – Deliver child health services and preventive care
- **Community Health Workers** – Conduct home visits and provide health education
- **Nutritionists** – Provide counseling and monitor child growth and development
- **Pharmacists** – Manage medication dispensing and patient counseling

**Administrative and Support Staff:**
- **Health Information Officers** – Manage data quality and system administration
- **Program Coordinators** – Oversee MCH program implementation and monitoring
- **Supply Chain Managers** – Ensure availability of essential commodities

**Patients and Families:**
- **Pregnant Women and New Mothers** – Primary beneficiaries of maternal health services
- **Children and Caregivers** – Recipients of child health and development services
en.preconditions:
**Infrastructure Requirements:**
- Reliable internet connectivity at health facilities
- Mobile network coverage for community-based services
- Basic computing equipment (tablets, smartphones) for healthcare workers
- Established referral networks between community and facility-based care

**Technical Prerequisites:**
- Functional health information management system (OpenMRS or similar)
- Integration capabilities with existing systems (DHIS2, supply chain management)
- Mobile application development and deployment infrastructure
- Data backup and security protocols

**Human Resources:**
- Trained healthcare providers familiar with MCH protocols
- IT support staff for system maintenance and troubleshooting
- Program managers with experience in digital health implementation
- Community health workers with basic digital literacy
en.process_steps:
**Phase 1: System Design and Development (Months 1-6)**
1. Conduct stakeholder consultations and requirements gathering
2. Design user interfaces for different types of healthcare workers
3. Develop core modules for antenatal, delivery, postnatal, and child health care
4. Create mobile applications for community health workers and patients
5. Establish data standards and interoperability protocols
6. Develop training materials and user guides

**Phase 2: Pilot Implementation (Months 7-12)**
1. Deploy system in selected pilot sites (2-3 health facilities)
2. Train healthcare workers on new digital workflows
3. Begin patient enrollment and data collection
4. Test integration with existing health information systems
5. Monitor system performance and user feedback
6. Refine features based on real-world usage

**Phase 3: Scale-up and Integration (Months 13-24)**
1. Expand to additional health facilities and communities
2. Integrate with national health information systems
3. Establish data sharing protocols with other health programs
4. Implement quality assurance and continuous monitoring procedures
5. Develop sustainability and scale-up plans
6. Create knowledge sharing and learning networks

**Phase 4: Optimization and Innovation (Months 25-36)**
1. Implement advanced analytics and predictive modeling
2. Integrate artificial intelligence for decision support
3. Develop patient portal and engagement features
4. Establish interoperability with regional health networks
5. Create evidence base for policy and practice recommendations
en.postconditions:
**Immediate Health System Improvements:**
- Standardized and comprehensive MCH data collection and reporting
- Improved care coordination between community and facility-based providers
- Enhanced tracking of maternal and child health indicators
- Reduced duplication of services and improved efficiency

**Patient-Centered Outcomes:**
- Increased antenatal care attendance and completion rates
- Improved immunization coverage and timeliness
- Enhanced nutrition counseling and growth monitoring
- Better patient engagement and health literacy

**System-Level Impact:**
- Evidence-based program planning and resource allocation
- Improved quality of care through standardized protocols
- Enhanced capacity for emergency referrals and management
- Strengthened health information systems and data governance
en.data_requirements:
**Patient Demographics and Registration:**
- Unique patient identifiers and biometric data
- Contact information and emergency contacts
- Socioeconomic and geographic information
- Insurance and payment information

**Clinical Data:**
- Comprehensive medical history and risk factors
- Antenatal visit records and screening results
- Delivery outcomes and complications
- Immunization records and schedules
- Growth measurements and nutritional assessments
- Laboratory results and diagnostic imaging

**Program and Administrative Data:**
- Healthcare provider information and credentials
- Facility capacity and service availability
- Supply chain and inventory data
- Quality indicators and performance metrics

**Data Quality and Governance:**
- Data validation rules and quality checks
- Audit trails and version control
- Privacy and security protocols
- Data sharing agreements and consent management

standards.name: HL7 FHIR
standards.description: For maternal and child health data exchange and interoperability

standards.name: ICD-10
standards.description: For standardized coding of maternal and child health conditions

standards.name: OpenHIE
standards.description: For health information exchange architecture and governance

en.technology_components:
**Core Clinical Platform:**
- **OpenMRS** configured for maternal and child health workflows
- Custom modules for antenatal care, delivery, and child health tracking
- Integration with laboratory and imaging systems
- Clinical decision support tools and alerts

**Mobile and Community Health:**
- Android/iOS mobile applications for community health workers
- Offline data collection and synchronization capabilities
- SMS and USSD integration for patient communication
- GPS tracking for community visits and coverage mapping

**Data Management and Analytics:**
- **DHIS2** integration for program monitoring and reporting
- Real-time dashboards and visualization tools
- Automated report generation and indicator calculation
- Data warehouse and business intelligence capabilities

**Supply Chain Integration:**
- **MediTrack** for managing vaccines, medications, and supplies
- Automated reorder points and stock-out alerts
- Cold chain monitoring for vaccine management
- Distribution tracking and waste management
en.challenges:
**Technical Implementation Challenges:**
- Ensuring system reliability and performance under high user loads
- Managing complex data flows between multiple systems and platforms
- Maintaining data quality and completeness across different user groups
- Implementing robust security measures for sensitive health information
- Supporting offline functionality in areas with poor connectivity

**User Adoption and Training:**
- Overcoming resistance to change from traditional paper-based systems
- Providing comprehensive training to diverse user groups with varying technical skills
- Ensuring user interface design meets the needs of different healthcare roles
- Managing workflow disruptions during transition periods

**Health System Integration:**
- Aligning with existing health policies and protocols
- Coordinating with multiple stakeholders and decision-makers
- Securing sustained funding for implementation and maintenance
- Ensuring compliance with national health information standards

**Sustainability and Scale:**
- Building local technical capacity for ongoing system support
- Developing sustainable financing models for long-term operation
- Creating governance structures for system evolution and improvement
- Managing system updates and technology refresh cycles
en.sustainability_considerations:
**Financial Sustainability Framework:**
- Integration with existing health system budgets and planning processes
- Development of cost-sharing mechanisms between government and partners
- Creation of fee-for-service models for specialized digital health services
- Leveraging economies of scale through shared infrastructure and services

**Technical and Operational Sustainability:**
- Building local technical capacity for system administration and support
- Establishing clear governance structures and decision-making processes
- Creating robust backup and disaster recovery procedures
- Planning for regular system updates and technology refresh

**Institutional and Policy Sustainability:**
- Embedding digital health procedures in national policies and guidelines
- Creating regulatory frameworks for digital health data and privacy
- Establishing performance monitoring and quality improvement systems
- Building political support and champion networks for continued investment

**Community and User Sustainability:**
- Ensuring meaningful community engagement and feedback mechanisms
- Building user satisfaction and perceived value of digital health services
- Creating peer support networks and learning communities
- Developing local innovation and adaptation capabilities

fr.title: Plateforme Numérique Intégrée de Santé Maternelle et Infantile
fr.purpose: Mettre en œuvre une plateforme de santé numérique complète qui soutient le continuum de soins pour les mères et les enfants de la grossesse jusqu'aux cinq premières années de vie, améliorant les résultats de santé grâce à une prestation de soins coordonnée.
fr.scope:
Ce cas d'usage englobe le développement et le déploiement d'une plateforme numérique intégrée qui :

- Gère le continuum complet de santé maternelle et infantile
- Intègre les soins cliniques, le suivi des vaccinations, la surveillance de la croissance
- Soutient les agents de santé communautaire avec des outils mobiles
- Fournit des analyses en temps réel pour le suivi des programmes
fr.actors:
**Prestataires de Soins Primaires :**
- **Obstétriciens et Sages-femmes** – Fournissent des soins maternels spécialisés
- **Pédiatres et Infirmiers** – Délivrent les services de santé infantile
- **Agents de Santé Communautaire** – Conduisent les visites à domicile
- **Nutritionnistes** – Fournissent des conseils et surveillent la croissance
fr.preconditions:
**Exigences d'Infrastructure :**
- Connectivité internet fiable dans les établissements de santé
- Couverture réseau mobile pour les services communautaires
- Équipement informatique de base pour les agents de santé
- Réseaux de référence établis entre les soins communautaires et hospitaliers
fr.process_steps:
**Phase 1 : Conception et Développement du Système (Mois 1-6)**
1. Conduire les consultations des parties prenantes
2. Concevoir les interfaces utilisateur pour différents types d'agents
3. Développer les modules principaux pour les soins prénataux et infantiles
4. Créer des applications mobiles pour les agents communautaires
fr.postconditions:
**Améliorations Immédiates du Système de Santé :**
- Collecte et rapport standardisés des données SMI
- Coordination améliorée des soins entre prestataires
- Suivi renforcé des indicateurs de santé maternelle et infantile
- Réduction de la duplication des services
fr.data_requirements:
**Données Démographiques et d'Enregistrement :**
- Identifiants patients uniques et données biométriques
- Informations de contact et contacts d'urgence
- Informations socioéconomiques et géographiques

standards.name: HL7 FHIR
standards.description: Pour l'échange de données de santé maternelle et infantile

standards.name: ICD-10
standards.description: Pour le codage standardisé des conditions de santé maternelle et infantile

fr.technology_components:
**Plateforme Clinique Principale :**
- **OpenMRS** configuré pour les flux de travail de santé maternelle et infantile
- Modules personnalisés pour les soins prénataux et le suivi de l'enfant
- Intégration avec les systèmes de laboratoire et d'imagerie
fr.challenges:
**Défis de Mise en Œuvre Technique :**
- Assurer la fiabilité et performance du système sous forte charge
- Gérer les flux de données complexes entre plateformes multiples
- Maintenir la qualité des données à travers différents groupes d'utilisateurs
fr.sustainability_considerations:
**Cadre de Durabilité Financière :**
- Intégration avec les budgets et processus de planification du système de santé
- Développement de mécanismes de partage des coûts
- Création de modèles de services payants pour les services de santé numérique

es.title: Plataforma Digital Integrada de Salud Materno-Infantil
es.purpose: Implementar una plataforma de salud digital integral que apoye el continuo de atención para madres y niños desde el embarazo hasta los primeros cinco años de vida, mejorando los resultados de salud a través de la prestación coordinada de atención.
es.scope:
Este caso de uso abarca el desarrollo e implementación de una plataforma digital integrada que:

- Gestiona el continuo completo de salud materno-infantil
- Integra atención clínica, seguimiento de inmunizaciones, monitoreo del crecimiento
- Apoya a trabajadores de salud comunitaria con herramientas móviles
- Proporciona análisis en tiempo real para monitoreo de programas
es.actors:
**Proveedores de Atención Primaria:**
- **Obstetras y Parteras** – Proporcionan atención materna especializada
- **Pediatras y Enfermeros** – Brindan servicios de salud infantil
- **Trabajadores de Salud Comunitaria** – Realizan visitas domiciliarias
- **Nutricionistas** – Proporcionan asesoramiento y monitorean el crecimiento
es.preconditions:
**Requisitos de Infraestructura:**
- Conectividad a internet confiable en establecimientos de salud
- Cobertura de red móvil para servicios comunitarios
- Equipo informático básico para trabajadores de salud
- Redes de referencia establecidas entre atención comunitaria y hospitalaria
es.process_steps:
**Fase 1: Diseño y Desarrollo del Sistema (Meses 1-6)**
1. Realizar consultas con partes interesadas
2. Diseñar interfaces de usuario para diferentes tipos de trabajadores
3. Desarrollar módulos principales para atención prenatal e infantil
4. Crear aplicaciones móviles para trabajadores comunitarios
es.postconditions:
**Mejoras Inmediatas del Sistema de Salud:**
- Recolección y reporte estandarizado de datos SMI
- Coordinación mejorada de atención entre proveedores
- Seguimiento mejorado de indicadores de salud materno-infantil
- Reducción de duplicación de servicios
es.data_requirements:
**Datos Demográficos y de Registro:**
- Identificadores únicos de pacientes y datos biométricos
- Información de contacto y contactos de emergencia
- Información socioeconómica y geográfica

standards.name: HL7 FHIR
standards.description: Para intercambio de datos de salud materno-infantil

standards.name: ICD-10
standards.description: Para codificación estandarizada de condiciones de salud materno-infantil

es.technology_components:
**Plataforma Clínica Principal:**
- **OpenMRS** configurado para flujos de trabajo de salud materno-infantil
- Módulos personalizados para atención prenatal y seguimiento infantil
- Integración con sistemas de laboratorio e imagen
es.challenges:
**Desafíos de Implementación Técnica:**
- Asegurar confiabilidad y rendimiento del sistema bajo alta carga
- Gestionar flujos de datos complejos entre múltiples plataformas
- Mantener calidad de datos a través de diferentes grupos de usuarios
es.sustainability_considerations:
**Marco de Sostenibilidad Financiera:**
- Integración con presupuestos y procesos de planificación del sistema de salud
- Desarrollo de mecanismos de compartición de costos
- Creación de modelos de servicios de pago para servicios de salud digital
